RJ's experiments are to collect data so I can form=C2=A0=
 conclusions based on objective results.=C2=A0 That may prove some theories=
 true, or prove some theories false.=C2=A0 Or show some theories are simply=
 not testable. That is not debunking.

Frank describes the group: "I invite anyone interested to join. I am not re=
ally scientific, I just take the approach, try different methods, see what =
works. I go on the results I get"


It doesn't say "Only for those who beli=
eve what we do".

I realize you have plenty of su=
bjective anecdotal evidence.I don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.=
=C2=A0 I am looking for something a little more objective and less subject =
to influence and interpretations.


And stop putting words in my mouth. A p=
erson can misinterpret something, mistake something, or confuse something, =
without lying about something.=C2=A0 And before you jump down my throat cla=
iming I am saying all results are mistakes, I am not.=C2=A0 I am performing=
 experiments, keeping an open mind, and considering all evidence I find. 

=

The way you have been attacking me by calling me names at every turn, just=
 because I try new things and don't always agree with your world view, is e=
erily reminiscent of the way the church of old tried to suppress new though=
t and discoveries, except you're just substituting the word 'heretic' with =
'science'. and 'blasphemy' with anything that disagrees with you.


There's=
 an old saying:=C2=A0 "We become that which we hate".=C2=A0 So far, all you=
've done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods and see what works=
.=C2=A0 You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not agree with y=
ou.=C2=A0 That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic you ri=
dicule.

=C2=A0
You certainly don't have to agree with my comments.=C2=A0 A=
nd I don't have to agree with yours.=C2=A0 But no one needs all the name ca=
lling Frank.=C2=A0=C2=A0 It really adds nothing to support your theories.

=

I don't think I have enough data yet to make=
 any conclusions, so I plan more experiments.=C2=A0 Since there are differe=
nt distinct claims about what the box or the recorders can do, I try to mak=
e different distinct experiments for each.


Some people claim they can get=
 the box to tell them things that the operator couldn't know, so my "whats =
the object" experiment is one way to examine that.=C2=A0 Some people claim =
the boxes can make predictions, so cataloging predictions and examining the=
 results can help examine that.=C2=A0 If there are other claims, I will try=
 to figure experiments based on those.

valign=3D"top">I realize you have plenty of subjective anecdotal evidence.I=
 don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.  I am looking for someth=
ing a little more objective and less subject to influence and interpretatio=
ns.<br>
<br>And stop putting words in my mouth. A person can misinterpret s=
omething, mistake something, or confuse something, without lying about some=
thing.  And before you jump down my throat claiming I am saying all re=
sults are mistakes, I am not.  I am performing experiments, keeping an=
 open mind, and considering all evidence I find. <br>
<br>The way you have =
been attacking me by calling me names at every turn, just because I try new=
 things and don't always agree with your world view, is eerily reminiscent =
of the way the church of old tried to suppress new thought and discoveries,=
 except you're just substituting the word 'heretic' with 'science'. and 'bl=
asphemy' with anything that disagrees with you.<br>
<br>There's an old sayi=
ng:  "We become that which we hate".  So far, all you've done is =
denounce people's efforts to try new methods and see what works.  You =
accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not agree with you.  Th=
at is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic you ridicule.<br>
=
 <br>You certainly don't have to agree with my comments.  And I d=
on't have to agree with yours.  But no one needs all the name calling =
Frank.   It really adds nothing to support your theories.<br><br>=

hat's about all there is in this field. Perhaps you should take bird watchi=

ing us all liars, and I find very insulting. </div>

fit the phenomon into a diffintion where it will not fit and does not belon=
g, and then claim you're looking for a more rational explantation, it just =
does not make sense. I say forget the BS "science" whatever that is, puts o=
ut and try thinking on your own.  Mr Spock was a fictional charactor!<=
/div>

=3D"top">I don't think I have enough data yet to make any conclusions, so I=

ut what the box or the recorders can do, I try to make different distinct e=
xperiments for each.<br>
<br>Some people claim they can get the box to tell=

riment is one way to examine that.  Some people claim the boxes can ma=
ke predictions, so cataloging predictions and examining the results can hel=
p examine that.  If there are other claims, I will try to figure exper=
iments based on those.<br>
